CLUE: A cloche (anag) - spiral cavity of the inner ear
FOUND IN: Cochlea - This isn't an exact anagram of "cloche," but it is the correct term for the spiral cavity of the inner ear where sound vibrations are transformed into electrical signals that can be interpreted by the brain.

Lady Hamilton's admiral lover - This clue refers directly to "Lord Nelson," who was known as Admiral Horatio Nelson, the famous British naval commander and reportedly had an affair with Emma Hart, also known as Lady Hamilton.

CLUE: Piece of reckless or mischievous conduct

FOUND IN: Before his death, he instructed that all of his unpublished works should be destroyed; however, his friend and literary executor Max Brod famously ignored these instructions and instead edited and published the manuscripts Kafka left behind, which included "The Trial," "The Castle," and "Amerika." Without this act, Kafka'cued by Franz Kafka.
